events.name: AIDS Action Committee
events.descr: Since 1993, Check-In volunteers have provided information and referrals, along with ,a sensitive and caring ear, to AIDS Action Committee’s clients, helping to maintain a strong connection between clients and staff members. Volunteers complement our services by helping clients work through problems and encouraging successes over the phone.
events.dates: Tuesday and Wednesday nights 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm

events.name: All Hands and Hearts
events.descr: We are currently working around the world to help communities affected by natural disasters. As a volunteer, you'd be a critical part of rebuilding homes and schools for community members post-disaster.
events.dates: We accept volunteers on a rolling basis for however long you're available. We've had volunteers join us for a day, a week, or even months on end!
events.location: Our programs are in Texas, Puerto Rico, the US Virgin Islands, the British Virgin Islands, Mexico and Dominica. Once you apply and are confirmed, you will receive the exact address and directions to the base.

events.name: Art Resource Collaborative for Kids (ARCK)
events.descr: Miles of Murals is a free community wide festival along David Ortiz Dr. across from Fenway Park. There will be an area for vendors, activities, food, and dancing.  There will also be live chalk artists along David Ortiz Dr. that will lead to the unveiling of our mural project Miles of Murals: Walls that Speak.  After the unveiling, there will be a ticketed gallery reception and silent auction featuring art from our students and local artists.
events.dates: May 4 2019. 11-9pm; various time slots within we will work with you

events.name: Artists for Humanity
events.descr: The best way to volunteer with Artists For Humanity is to come visit our studios, meet our young people, and talk with us about how you can become involved. Volunteers spread the word about what our teens can do, promote our art work, refer young people who could benefit from working with us, work on special projects and/or provide 1:1 tutoring to teens. Tutoring is one of the key ways to get involved. As an after-work supplemental program, tutoring provides critical support to AFH teen artists to ensure a stronger pathway toward academic success.
events.dates: Our program runs on Mondays and Fridays from 3pm-6pm and on Tuesdays Wednesdays and Thursdays from 6pm-8pm. In general we ask that volunteers commit to one day a week for at least one semester.

events.name: Bilingual Education for Central America
events.descr: BECA aims to provide its volunteers with a challenging, transformative experience that gives an in-depth understanding of grassroots international development, underserved Central American communities, bilingual teaching strategies, and community capacity building techniques. As a result, BECA teachers develop the skills and responsibilities to be effective teachers, communicators, and leaders.
events.dates: July 8 2019 to June 2020 for full-year volunteers who commit to one academic school year. January 2020 to June 2020 for half-year volunteers.
events.location: Cofradia and Vida Nueva Cortes; Macuelizo, Santa Barabara, Honduras

events.name: Boston Center for Refugee Health and Human Rights
events.descr: BCRHHR is looking for highly motivated people with excellent interpersonal and communication skills to support our mission.  Volunteer opportunities involving direct client contact are determined on a case by case basis.  Many opportunities are administrative or research oriented.
events.dates: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm
events.location: Boston Medical Center - Dowling 7 840 Harrison Ave

events.name: Boston Landmarks Orchestra
events.descr: Boston Landmarks Orchestra hosts summer orchestral concert series at the Hatch Shell. Volunteers should arrive by 5:30 PM and will finish close to 9:30 pm. The concert will be held in the Hatch Memorial Shell on the Esplanade, located at 47 David G Mugar Way, Boston, MA 02108. The nearest MBTA stations are the Charles/MGH stop on the Red Line and the Arlington stop on the Green Line. Volunteers will be passing out programs, intercepting surveys, providing customer service at information tent, helping with chair rentals, and floating to perform other duties as needed. All volunteers receive a free t-shirt, snacks, and get to enjoy great music!
events.dates: Every Wednesday beginning 7/11/18 to 8/29/18 from 5:30-9:30pm. Doesn't have to be every Wednesday

events.name: Boston Partners in Education
events.descr: Boston Partners places volunteer academic mentors into BPS classrooms to give students more individualized attention during the school day.  Volunteers are matched according to their preferences and availability to supports students in their academic and social-emotional learning for one hour each week of the school year.  We welcome volunteers of all backgrounds, but are an especially great fit for anyone interested in pursuing education or social work as a career path.
events.dates: Applications accepted on a rolling basis from July-January

events.name: Boston's Forgotten Felines
events.descr: We want to help end the overpopulation of feral and homeless cats on the streets of Boston.  To this end we trap, neuter (or spay) feral and homeless cats.  We coordinate other veterinary care for these cats when necessary.  We release fixed feral cats and ensure their survival by providing daily care for them in their street homes (known as colonies), including monitoring for health, safety and new arrivals, feeding, providing shelter and other protection from the elements.  We evaluate homeless cats for adoptability and turn these cats over to local, no-kill animal shelters or foster homes.  We provide support to these shelters and foster homes upon request.  And, although we believe that a program of TNR (Trap, Neuter, Release) is a vital part of ending overpopulation, we know that it is not the only part.  Education is a very important part of the solution. We provide education to the public about the importance of spay and neuter programs and the about problems faced by homeless cats.  We will train volunteers to help us with any or all of these activities.
events.dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: Cambridge Community Television
events.descr: CCTV relies on volunteers to keep our organization running smoothly. Interns provide CCTV with valuable work hours every week in many difference capacities, and in exchange our interns get experience and training in everything that makes a television station tick. Possible unpaid intern positions include live cablecasting, media production, computer lab supervision, training and education, and many administrative responsibilities. All interns work 2-10 hours per week and receive an Access Membership, regardless of residency. There are many departments to intern in. CCTV relies on volunteers who agree to provide regular assistance to staff in some area of operations. Anyone, regardless of their age or place of residence, may apply to become a CCTV intern. Please note, not all kinds of internships are available at all times, as openings depend on CCTV's needs at the moment. However, even if the kind of internship you are interested in is not immediately available, we will keep your application on file should there be an opening.
events.dates: Varied
events.location: Cambridge Community Television 438 Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge MA 02139

events.name: Chelsea Collaborative
events.descr: The Collaborative runs an after school program for our middle and high school youth. The middle school program focuses on art as a form of therapeutic expression and literacy, while the high school program focuses on homework/academic support. We are seeking volunteers to work in either program.
events.dates: Monday-Thursday, weekly, 4-7pm (Ideally volunteers would commit to coming in on the same days each week)

events.name: Cradles to Crayons
events.descr: The Champion Program is for students who would like to volunteer on a weekly or bi-weekly basis during one of our designated two and a half hour shifts . As a Champion, volunteers will be trained in at least one of our donation processing stations. Once a Champion is trained, they are responsible for leading the station with anywhere from 10-25 volunteers. For example, an Outfit Station Champion orients and oversees a group of volunteers as they put together outfit packs that contain about a week's worth of clothing.
events.dates: We are looking for reliable students to commit to a regular weekly or bi-weekly schedule. We are looking for a commitment for an entire semester at a time. Our shifts are as follows: Wednesday through Saturday Morning Shift: 9:45 am-12:15 pm Afternoon Shift: 1:15 pm-3:45 pm.

events.name: Daily Table
events.descr: Volunteers are an integral part of the Daily Table family. As we continue to receive more produce from our agricultural and retail partners, the need for volunteers grows. Volunteers can expect to: sort and prepare produce in our receiving area for sale or for kitchen use, label and package prepared foods alongside our kitchen staff, help cooks in the kitchen, stock retail shelves, stock/reorganize cooler and freezer units,interact with customers in our food sampling/engagement area
events.dates: Monday-Saturday: 9am-8pm; Sunday: 11am-6pm. Require minimum of 3 hours for kitchen volunteers. 10 volunteers allowed per each hour slot

events.name: Day or Night Care
events.descr: At home care services for underserved elderly population. Tasks can include light cooking, cleaning, shopping, etc. as well as basic companionship.
events.dates: Year round - 24/7

events.name: Department of Children and Families
events.descr: For a few hours of your time each month, you can participate on a panel that helps plan a brighter future for each child in care. DCF is required by law to review each foster child's case every six months. The review is conducted by a three member panel, with one member being from the local community. A volunteer reviewer can make a difference for child. For more information http://www.mass.gov/eohhs/gov/departments/dcf/giving/volunteer-case-review/  Or contact us at 1-800-286-0323
events.dates: The schedules are flexible and happen Monday-Friday during business hours.

events.name: Discovering Justice
events.descr: Children Discovering Justice (CDJ) is a literacy-based social studies curriculum for elementary and middle school, that provides students with the tools to understand sophisticated ideas such as democracy, tolerance, rights, responsibilities, and the connection between rules and law. CDJ includes interactive mock trials that further empower children to stand up for their beliefs, engage in respectful discourse, and resolve differences in constructive ways. Volunteers are needed to support students during these Mock Trial Field Trips.
events.dates: Throughout the School Year between 10:00AM and 12:00PM

events.name: El Centro Del Cardenal Language School- Catholic Charities
events.descr: This school is a free, intensive, community-based ESL(English as a second language) school. We are looking for volunteers to come to our classes once a week and engage with our students. Most of our students are immigrants learning English, improving their academic skills, and trying to assimilate into American society. Our students do not get much access to native speakers besides the time they spend with their teachers. I would like to invite anyone who is interested in helping our students to come to our school.
events.dates: Monday-Thursday anytime between 9am-1pm
events.location: 19 St Joseph St Jamaica Plain MA 02130

events.name: Family Gym
events.descr: Family Gym provides an open environment that encourages families to be active together through non-fee based recreational use of Boston’s community centers (BCYF). Each week volunteers assist the supervisor in leading activity stations such as jump rope, toddler slide, or soccer with participants. Family Gym holds 8 to 10 sessions on Saturday mornings from 10:00 m to 11:30am for families each semester in several Boston communities to promote healthy eating habits and increased physical activity through play. Volunteers are allowed 2 absences per semester. Our programming consists of unstructured free play, a health theme, structured group games, and a cool down activity (animal stretches).
events.dates: Saturdays from 9:00AM to 12:00 PM / October to December (Fall Semester) or February to April (Spring Semester)

events.name: Fighting Against Multiple Sclerosis (FAMS)
events.descr: The MS Ambassador program is run by FAMS with the collaboration of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, The Greater New England Chapter. MS Ambassadors are individuals who are passionate about the cause, and they attend volunteer fairs, representing FAMS and the National MS Society, attend fundraiser and awareness events, and advocate for change.
events.dates: Multiple opportunities during the calendar year (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: Fresh Truck
events.descr: Fresh Truck is a nonprofit mobile food market working to radically impact community health by getting food to people that need it the most. Fresh Truck volunteers work on the bus at markets to engage with customers, bag and restock items on the bus, as well as assist in clean up at the end. And if volunteers help us out, we'll send them home with a free bag of groceries!
events.dates: Opportunities Sunday-Friday every week

events.name: Gift of Life
events.descr: To enter the bone registry, all a person needs to do is swab the inside of their cheek! Then they'll be entered into the registry and has the opportunity to potentially match with someone who is battling blood cancer, essentially saving their life
events.dates: ongoing (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: Girl's LIFE
events.descr: We are looking for volunteers to serve as mentors for our teen girls! We partner workshops with one-to-one mentoring, so you can have an impact on an individual's life. For 10 program days, you meet with our group and help provide support for your mentee. No financial background necessary! We will orient/ train all volunteers prior to start. This date and time is TBD based off of volunteers' availability.
events.dates: March 6-May 8 Wednesdays 5:30-7:30pm

events.name: Haitian-American Public Health Initiatives
events.descr: HAPHI is interested in serving as a site for student volunteers to assist with teaching adult ESOL classes
events.dates: Monday and Friday ESOL classes from 10:00 AM- 12:00 PM

events.name: Haley House
events.descr: Haley House, a 50-year-old nonprofit in Boston, operates a soup kitchen, food pantry, urban farm, and housing program in the South End, and a Bakery Café and pizza restaurant in Dudley Square. Haley House is seeking 3–5 interns and summer residents for its summer internship and residency program this year. Interns and residents are unpaid, though room and board are provided. Interns and residents will be integrated into life in the Live-In Community, a group of residential volunteers who co-manage Haley House’s direct services and commit to life together as a community, building deep connections with each other and our guests.
events.dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter
events.descr: The Harvard Square Homeless Shelter (HSHS) and Y2Y Harvard Square need volunteers to help provide shelter at a critical time of the year for individuals experiencing homelessness in the local community. Volunteers are needed for breakfast, dinner, evening, and overnight shifts. Our shelters offer opportunities for students to develop understanding of the greater issues surrounding homelessness and gain leadership experience! Start your volunteer journey by applying for a regular weekly shift, a break shift, or one time substitute shifts; both individuals and groups are welcome. Contact hshs.engagement@gmail.com or volunteer.y2y@gmail.com to learn more!
events.dates: November 1 - April 15
events.location: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter 66 Winthrop Street Cambridge MA 02138

events.name: Have a Hart Day Boston
events.descr: We will be sorting food in a warehouse. This will involve being on your feet, possibly lifting 30 lb. boxes, and possibly interacting with packaged frozen meat/pork products.

events.name: Hernández After School Program
events.descr: We are looking for volunteers to serve as tutors, club leaders, and extra support during our after school program. This position would be best suited for volunteers who love working with youth, are interested in education, tutoring, and mentoring, and who are comfortable in a multi-lingual and multi-cultural environment. Scheduling is flexible, as the program runs Monday-Friday from 3:15pm-6:15pm. We ask that our volunteers serve at least one hour a week during the program for at least one semester. Bilingual English/Spanish volunteers or those interested in learning Spanish are preferred.
events.dates: Monday-Friday 3:15pm-6:15pm
events.location: Rafael Hernández School 61 School St. Roxbury MA 02119

events.name: Horizons for Homeless Children
events.descr: BECOME A SUPERHERO TO HOMELESS CHILDREN!Horizons needs volunteers throughout the Boston Metro area to make a difference in the lives of children living in family homeless shelters. By volunteering each week to play children who otherwise wouldn’t have this opportunity, you’ll become their superhero.Volunteer with homeless children at a Horizons Playspace installed in one of more than 90 family shelters state-wide including in Dorchester, Roxbury, Mattapan, Jamaica Plain, Newton, Brighton, Charlestown, East Boston, Fenway, Somerville, and Cambridge. An initial training and a commitment of two hours a week for six months are required. Horizons for Homeless Children is a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of homeless children by providing opportunities for quality play and early education. To find out more, view other training dates, or to apply, call 617.553.5488 or visit horizonschildren.org/playspace.
events.dates: Weekly 2 hour commitment for at least 6 months. Same day and time. Shift options Monday-Thursday 6-8pm
events.location: Boston Area SheltersTraining is at 1705 Columbus Ave Roxbury. Volunteering takes place at 27 sites all over Boston area

events.name: Housing Families Inc.
events.descr: Work with kids who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in a variety of ways. Housing Families offer kids (from pre-k-12th grade) access to tutoring, childcare, enrichment groups, therapeutic groups and counseling. Volunteer hours are from 3-6 Monday-Friday (Wednesday 3-7) for tutoring, and 6-730 pm Monday-Thursday for childcare. Volunteers are only required to commit to one hour/week. Interns can help with tutoring, childcare, and enrichment groups during those same time blocks. Interns are also welcome to come in earlier in the day to help with other projects around our program including, helping with folders for tutoring, organizing program, sorting and organizing books, preparing enrichment group activities, and other assorted jobs around the office.
events.dates: Monday-Friday 3-6 (Wednesday 3-7) -- weekly

events.name: Immigrant Learning Center
events.descr: In the classroom, you can help new Americans achieve their personal and professional goals through learning English and gaining an understanding of American culture.
events.dates: Classes are Monday through Friday 9:00 am- 11:30 am and Monday through Thursday 12:00-3:00. The ILC asks that volunteers commit to at least one class per week.

events.name: Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Boston
events.descr: JBBBS engages children and adults of all faiths and backgrounds, including a growing number of new immigrant children and their families.  Our children's program is a Big Brother/Big Sister community match program for children (ages 6-18).  Volunteers(ages 21+) meet their matches 2x/mo for 2-4 hrs mostly on weekends with a year commitment.  In the Friend 2 Friend adults with disabilities program(ages 18+), matches create their own schedules and meet 1-2x/mo for 2-4 hours with a year commitment. In the Friend 2 Friend MAGIC Program(Monthly Activity Groups in the Community), matches meet one designated evening per month at a pre-planned group activity with other pairs of friends. Activities are mostly in the Brookline, Brighton, Allston areas and are a great fit for those who use public transportation.  MAGIC requires a one year commitment.
events.dates: Children and Adults with Disabilities Community Programs-create your own schedules. MAGIC program meets once a month at pre-designated evening (Wednesdays and Sundays) or afternoon(Sundays). All meet for 1 year.
events.location: JBBBS is located in Newton but serves children and adults in 90 cities and towns in MA

events.name: Jews for Racial and Economic Justice
events.descr: Jews for Racial & Economic Justice (JFREJ) welcomes volunteers to help out on a regular basis in our office. We also have one-time volunteering events periodically, including phone banks and mailing parties. Details and upcoming opportunities can be found at our events calendar. Check our website for information about internships and organizing fellowships.
events.dates: Varies but typically weekday evenings. Regular shifts can also be scheduled within normal office hours

events.name: JumpStart
events.descr: Help preschoolers develop their language and literacy skills to prepare them for kindergarten and implement a proven curriculum in a classroom with a team of BU peers.
events.dates: Monday & Wednesday 3-5pm or Tuesday & Thursday 3-5pm

events.name: Learning Enterprises
events.descr: Learning Enterprises is a volunteer opportunity for students to teach English abroad in one of our 10 programs around the world. We have no program fees and hope that this will allow students of all backgrounds to have the opportunity to volunteer. They will be placed with a host family in a community and teach summer English classes to students who may not have the opportunity to have this extra English practice outside the regular school year. We believe strongly in cross cultural exchange and listening to the people we serve. Volunteers are trained to adapt completely to their students and classrooms so that each community gets what they need.
events.dates: Summer 2019

events.name: National MS Society
events.descr: Volunteer for Walk MS Boston at BU's Nickerson Field! Walk MS Boston is New England's largest Walk MS site. The event raises over $300,000 for MS research and services for people living with MS. Volunteers support the success, safety and spirit of the event by working assignments including walker registration, finish line cheering, food service and many more!
events.dates: Date: Sunday April 7th Times: Assignment times vary and range from 5:00am-12:00pm (see volunteer registration page for specific times)

events.name: Northern Haiti Sustainability Initiative
events.descr: Northern Haiti Sustainability Initiative (NHSI) is a small non-profit that focuses on supporting primary schools in Haiti by providing tuition support, basic books/supplies, and educational consulting. Our organization is looking for a volunteer to assist us with enhancements to the NHSI website, which informs the public about our programs and serves as a portal to solicit/receive donations. You will be working directly with our Vice Chairman to identify alternatives for changes needed, and implementing updates. Candidates should be comfortable with HTML coding and able to work independently. Prior experience with web design, WordPress, and shopping cart functionality is ideal, but not required if the candidate is willing to self-teach under the direction of NHSI management.
events.dates: 6 to 10 total hours for this project with potential opportunities future project involvement.

events.name: Oldways: A Taste of African Heritage
events.descr: A Taste of African Heritage is a 6-week series on nutrition education created by a  non-profit, Oldways, in order to teach communities how to live a healthier life with cultural history. The program includes all ages, with a special curriculum for children and is given at sites like schools, churches, and community centers across the US. We need volunteers to teach the curriculum which is composed of a history and nutrition lesson and a cooking demonstration of traditional foods, inspired by the African Diaspora.
events.dates: One time class: Boston Public Market, May 14: 4:30-8:00 pm Ongoing-Series: Wednesdays, June 6 - July 18, 6 to 8 pm - Daily Table,Dorchester
events.location: The Greater Boston Area but also other sites or a site of the student's choice that could host the program.

events.name: Rise Against Hunger
events.descr: Our organization’s approach to ending hunger centers on mobilizing a global network of hunger champions. Rise Against Hunger meal packaging volunteers produce millions of nutritious meals annually that are then distributed to partners in countries around the world. Those partners are best able to address the causes and effects of hunger based on their local presence and expertise. Through our thorough monitoring and evaluation process, we ensure the meals distributed by those partners are used as a tool to change lives by promoting education, improving students’ health and nutrition, addressing gender inequalities, stimulating economic growth and fighting child labor.
events.dates: Several different time slots available (20 hours a week are options)

events.name: Ronald McDonald House Boston Harbor
events.descr: Ronald McDonald House Boston Harbor provides cost-free housing to families of children who are undergoing critical medical treatment at Boston-area hospitals. We are looking for volunteers to assist with a variety of tasks within our House.
events.dates: Ongoing: Monday-Sunday 8am-8pm

events.name: Rose Kennedy Greenway Conservancy
events.descr: Art Ambassadors support our public art program by providing park-based ambassadors that are knowledgeable about contemporary art practices, the artwork on The Greenway and our park system. We are looking for people who are passionate about public art and public spaces, and are willing to work with a team to create meaningful experiences for park patrons.
events.dates: Thursdays-Sundays from late May-late September

events.name: Science on the Street- MIT Museum
events.descr: varies
events.dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: St. Stephen's Youth Programs
events.descr: We provide after school and summer programming for Boston Public School youth ranging from first to fifth. At SSYP, we offer academic enrichment opportunities like math and reading tutoring, fun days, like trips to local museums and parks, and other activities like yoga and arts & crafts. We also employee 9th through 12th grade students in leadership roles throughout the organization, providing them with job related training, as well as support around college access and success. The goal of this new partnership would be to have more college volunteers running programs and helping out with our mentor/tutor program. Volunteers could have the freedom to work with students from 1st through 12th grade throughout the course of their time with us.
events.dates: Monday- Friday: 2pm-6pm. Can pick day(s) that work with availability

events.name: Teen Voices Emerging
events.descr: TVE provides a platform for young females to voice their opinions on important social justice and women’s issues and allows them to respond with community outreach.This is a great opportunity for BPS girls not only to be heard but to also attain skill sets in writing, self-expression, leadership, and debate.
events.dates: 3:00PM-6:00PM (Spring Semester)

events.name: Union of Minority Neighborhoods (UMN)
events.descr: 1. A researcher to help us identify media outlets, universities, other nonprofits with contact information for our Black Ballot Power campaign. 2. Database entry support, for excel and mailchimp. 3. Help coordinating video, music and poetry contests for BBP.
events.dates: To be arranged with Sue

events.name: Uprooted and Rising
events.descr: Uprooted and Rising is hosting our first ever Northeast training - a weekend of real connection, strategic organizing, and of course real (good!) food. Our Northeast training will activate students and community members in the region towards learning about the movement and generating their own local chapters.
events.dates: March 1st -3rd
events.location: St. Mary's Episcopal Church 14 Cushing Ave Dorchester MA 02125

events.name: Urban Science Academy - Boston Public Schools
events.descr: We are looking for tutors in math, science and english to support our 9th and possible some 10th grade students during the day during their study blocks. our  9th grade students are really struggling academically and we are looking for additional academic support for them.
events.dates: September 2017- June 2018. During the day and/or after school

events.name: Victory Programs' Boston Living Center
events.descr: Serve Breakfast to the HIV + Community

events.name: Victory Programs' Revision Urban Farm
events.descr: We are looking volunteer groups to assist with restructuring our field.  This project will take place outdoors and will involve shoveling.
events.dates: March 2018 - October 2018

events.name: Wakefield Nursing Home
events.descr: Wakefield nursing home is looking for students interested in engaging with elders to showcase their talents to their community! Please contact Laura Moran for more details if you are interested.
events.dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

events.name: Wang YMCA
events.descr: Afterschool Program
events.location: Wang YMCA 8 Oak Street West Boston MA

events.name: WGBH's 5K for Public Media
events.descr: 5K run hosted by WGBH to raise money for public media
events.dates: Sunday April 14th 8:00am-Noon

events.name: WriteBoston
events.descr: Our job is to produce better writers, not better writing. We often go back to this statement from Stephen North, considered the father of the Writing Center movement, in order to remind ourselves that we are developing writers, not fixing papers. We are empowering teenagers through writing. We currently operate a Writing Center at Boston International Newcomers Academy (BINCA), located in Dorchester. The school is made up of English Language Learner (ELL) students with varying levels of writing and English abilities. The tutor’s role is to help students develop their writing skills with classroom assignments, college essays, scholarship applications, and other pieces of writing. The Writing Center is open Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 8 am-3 pm, and on Fridays from 8 am-1 pm, and we are seeking a 2-3 hour weekly commitment for the entire school year. This is a great opportunity to support ELL students and help develop them into powerful writers!
events.dates: Tuesdays Wednesdays and Thursdays from 8-3 pm and Fridays from 8-1 pm
events.location: Boston International High School 100 Maxwell Street Boston MA 02121 in Dorchester

events.name: Y2Y
events.descr: We are seeking volunteers to help keep our summertime, student-run homeless shelters operating for the next ~7 weeks during Y2Y Harvard Square’s Summer Season. There are 4 shifts daily: Dinner: 6:15 PM - 9:15 PM Evening: 9:00 PM - 11:15 PM Overnight: 11 PM - 9:00 AM Breakfast: 6:30 AM - 9:00 AM Times on weekends are slightly different: Friday & Saturday Overnight: 11 PM - 10:00 AM Saturday & Sunday Breakfast: 7:30 AM - 10:00 AM  Descriptions of the shifts: Breakfast: Come in bright and early to greet our guests! You'll be making breakfast and helping to clean the shelter (an invaluable service!) after all the guests leave at 8:00 am. Dinner: You'll be cooking and serving dinner, talking with guests, and perhaps making a food pick-up run from one of the many shops that donate to us. Evening: On the evening shift, help is often needed in the kitchen to clean up after dinner. This is also a relaxed time to visit the guests as they prepare for bed.  Overnight: You'll be hanging with other volunteer and night-owl guests, basically having more good conversations, watching movies, doing laundry, reading, baking cookies, and more! This is a fantastic shifts because it's a rare opportunity to have long conversations and get to know people well. Don't worry: we do take turns sleeping - the night is typically divided into three sub-shifts and you will be asleep for two of them (there is a staff room with bed, so you'll be able to sleep 5-6 hours when it is not your turn to be awake).
events.dates: June 12th - August 7th time dependent on shift
events.location: Y2Y Harvard Square Shelter: 1 Church St Cambridge MA 02138
